issues.title: Keys for DPoP should be attested to be highly secure
issues.author: awoie
issues.body: Let's make sure that keys we use for DPoP can be directly attested by the key attestation to be protected by the secure key store of the device (e.g. Secure Element, Secure Enclave etc.).

comments.author: Sakurann
comments.body: let's also make sure it is optimization and not a requirement in client attestation draft.

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body: Would that be a DPoP extension?

issues.title: A term alternative to "verifiable credentials"..?
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
need a term that can be used to refer to both verifiable credentials and mdocs, that is not "Verifiable Credentials"
some suggestions: 
- digital credentials
- Electronic attestations of attributes
- verifiable attestations

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body:
"Electronic attestations of attributes" sounds good. However in the eIDAS context is one category of credentials whereas the other one is called "Person Identification Data" - so EAA would not be perceived as term for all kinds of credentials.
"verifiable attestations" to me sounds very much like EAA.

I think "digital credentials" is the best option.   

PS: you know we will need to change the name of our spec family again once we pick a new term  ;-). I'm fine with that, just stating the obvious.

issues.title: [ed]
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: URLs to "eIDAS 2.0, California Department of Motor Vehicles, Open Wallet Foundation (OWF), IDunion, GAIN"

issues.title: Align and expand Scenarios/Business Requirements section
issues.author: Sakurann

comments.author: Sakurann
comments.body:
one from @awoie 
```
- customer applies for VC, in-person  (pre-authz) or remote (authz code)
- wallet requests access_token/credential
- downstream process kicks off and decision needs to be made by some special officer and cannot be automated based on prior decisions/authorizations
- wallet has to wait until decision was made
- special officer makes decision
- wallet requests token/credential again and token/credential endpoint can answer with final response.
```

comments.author: Sakurann
comments.body:
also from @awoie 

> Would it make sense to specifically describe the following scenarios:
> - high-security in-person provisioning with/without human in the loop in downstream processes
> - high-security remote provisioning with/without human in the loop in downstream processes
> - high-security online presentment, same device, cross-device (if we have a good solution for that).
> 
> Would it make sense to suggest assurance levels according to eIDAS/NIST?

issues.title: Note on JSON serialization and JAdES
issues.author: Sakurann

issues.title: issuer identifier - always HTTPS URL..?
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: Which HTTPS URL does the issuer use when x.509 is used? SAN? if we mandate issuer to do both x.509 and SAN, does that mean issuers must make sure /JWT-issuer is hosted under SAN? Isn’t that pretty limiting? (I am not necessarily opposed to “iss is always a URL, just trying to understand the implications)

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body:
According to the feedback we got so far on the concept, I think SNA is the way to go. 

I see value in the proposal @tplooker made to always use the same kind of `iss` value. It is especially beneficial if the credential has both the x.509 cert chain and support for web based key resolution, since the verifier can choose what data to use for validation. 

If the credential only has x.509, it doesn't matter in the end what identifier we use as long as the leaf cert binds that identifier to the public key of the issuer. So using the HTTPS URL doesn't hurt at least and might be inline with the way domain validated certs (and cWACs? @paulbastian) work. 

Even HTTPS URL with paths should work. I checked https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.6 and did not find an indication that this would not be possible. I mention it because as far as I remember someone stated that a SNA would only contain a URL with FQN but no path. 

> Isn’t that pretty limiting?
In my opinion, the issuer can freely choose the URL so it should not become a limitation. However, I also think we need implementors' feedback.

comments.author: paulbastian
comments.body: I agree using iss field for x509 as well. It has the advantage of having a common identifier for both mechanisms. EV and QWAC work the same way

issues.title: issuer key resolution requirements for each entity:
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
there are currently two options for issuer key resolution: web PKI based one and X.509 based one. current text states, "iissuer supports one of the options, wallet and verifier support both", but @tlodderstedt is right that this will make the life of verifiers (and wallets) really hard. 
probably need to discuss what it means for the issuer to support both x.509 and web pki based...

issues.title: client_id_scheme and client_assertion_type
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
need to discuss the relationship between `client_id_scheme` and `client_assertion_type`. 
- one way to think is: client_assertion_type acts as client_id_scheme so no need for a client_id_scheme
- another is: client_id_scheme is about how to process client_id and how to obtain client metadata, while client_assertion_type is which client authentication type to use, so they cannot be the same.

maybe the question is, when client_assertion_type is wallet attestation, do we expect client metadata to be obtained from wallet attestation or can there be other options?

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body:
In my opinion, `client_id_scheme` and `client_assertion_type` serve the same purpose. 

> maybe the question is, when client_assertion_type is wallet attestation, do we expect client metadata to be obtained from wallet attestation or can there be other options?

What client metadata do you mean? redirect URI, crypto algorithms? I would expect them to be communicated using the standard mechanisms, either oob or using a suitable parameter (just saw `client_metadata` is not in the VCI spec yet).

issues.title: define "ephemeral credential" as a term..?
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: from @peppelinux

comments.author: Sakurann
comments.body: i personally don't think it is necessary..

issues.title: `client_id` value of the wallet during issuance
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
The text current wallet attestation draft says:
> The JWT MUST contain a "sub" (subject) claim with a value corresponding to the "client_id" of the OAuth client.

the thing is.. when there has been no pre-existing relationship between the issuer and the wallet, which `client_id` value does the wallet uses..?

comments.author: Sakurann
comments.body: discussed with @tlodderstedt. `sub` is a self-attested value from the wallet front end to the wallet backend. the issuer does not really need to understand `sub`, more imp for audit trails and user consent.

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body: @paulbastian what do you do in your current implementation?

issues.title: value of `client_id_scheme`...
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: The value of the `client_id_scheme` parameter MUST be `wallet_attestation`.

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body: Where would we use this client id scheme?

issues.title: relationship between `sub` and pop key in wallet attestation
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
@peppelinux: a client_id or a sub value for this use case can be derived with a simple thumbprint value of the cnf.jwk, just to bind the identity of the wallet instance to one of its public key

I would suggest to leave this choice whether to bind sub and pop key to the wallet frontend

issues.title: [placeholder] add trust mechanism in the future versions
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: currently out of scope, but agreement to add before final

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body: I think the profile with key resolution and identifier authentication adds a lot in terms of interoperability. On the other hand, there are so many different technical means to manage trust, we will have a hard time to pin down THE one or two to endorse by the profile. I don't think we should delay publication due to this topic.

issues.title: Value of a custom URL scheme
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
current value is `haip` standing for "high assurance interop profile".

if you come up with a better one, I will buy you a drink

issues.title: communicating extra wallet capabilities when obtaining the request object
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: verifier sends a request_uri, when wallet hits that request_uri, it can communicate information such as version control. maybe using the headers. not urgent

issues.title: using a VC for Verifier Attestation
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: the core idea is: "Verifier obtains a VC from a trusted third party, a VC includes a key material of a Verifier, authorization request is signed using that key". need to define a schema for that VC.

comments.author: Sakurann
comments.body: this is what I have now: "When the Client Identifier Scheme is `verifier_attestation`, the Client Identifier MUST equal `sub` claim value in the Verifier attestation JWT. The request MUST be signed with the private key corresponding to the public key in the `cnf` claim in the Verifier attestation JWT. The Verifier attestation VC MUST be added to a newly defined `verifier_attestation` JOSE Header of a request object. The Wallet MUST validate the signature on the Verifier attestation JWT by a trusted third party. Verifier metadata MUST be obtained from the Verifier attestation JWT."

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body: Just check back with ppl from ETSi. They are in favor of (in addition to x.509 for qWACs and qSeals) having a VC-based mechanism for Verifier authentication.

issues.title: add back client_metadata?
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
I left it out in the first pass.
any protocol-related parameter that can be passed in the client_metadata like `subject_syntax_types_supported` is hard-coded in the profile. 
if there is a need to verifier related metadata like `logo_url`, `client_name`, etc. we should add it back

issues.title: attestation of the key signing SIOP ID Token
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: do we assume that the key used for the signature of the SIOPv2 id token must be attestable with a wallet instance attestation? from @peppelinux

comments.author: tlodderstedt
comments.body: I don't think so. it's the wallet (provider) that is being attested, not the key. Like for the issuance of credentials, where the wallet is attested and not the key the credential is bound to.

issues.title: How to constrain PE
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
how to constraint `fields`: 
- path (can the JSONPath be constrained?)
- filter (this is a JSON Schema! Must be constrained!)

issues.title: requesting presentation of 1 out of n credentials
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: One way is to use "submission_requirements". Another, arguably easier, way is to just state that whatever is requested, the wallet will always respond with a single credential, so no need the submission_requirement at all.

issues.title: “Verifiable Credentials” or “Digital Credentials”..?
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body: Can we please rename “Verifiable Credentials” to “Digital Credentials”? that’s the term already used in other OIDF whitepapers. to OID4DCI and OID4DCP and OID4DC

issues.title: make iat in SD-JWT selectively disclosable during presentation
issues.author: Sakurann
issues.body:
from @peppelinux
> well, the "human behaviour" may create the practice to get you to update the PID on your birthday, producing a certain information leakage in the meaning of iat. I propose that iat should be in MAY and that there is no problem with making it opaque and SD
